title: STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT EXERCISE PLANNER
description: FIRES SECTION CHIEF Daegu, South Korea Mar 2013 to June 2014 Supervised, recommended adjustments to policies, programs, projects and resolve problems and to improve operations for a 30 personnel organization that provided liaison and joint fire support (air, ground and sea delivered rocket and missile strikes) synchronization between Army and Air Forces throughout South Korea. Planned, coordinated, and trained 2 exercises quarterly throughout South Korea, integrating 2 Air Force Installations and 3 Army Installations to improve long term strategic operations. Provided advice on continuous improvement doctrine, methodology, and issues to organizational directorates, managers, or staff. Studied and mastered the complexities of the efficiencies in major core processes, strategic planning, and process management for Joint and combined fires fights; successfully applied them in the conduct of six Theater level exercises in support of 100 of civilian and military personnel. Performed analysis and made determinations and evaluated decisions with national and international consequences; document assessments and program operations. Trained 6 military personnel quarterly as Army’s lead for joint fire support digital sustainment training program. INTEGRATED PROJECT CHIEF / EXERCISE PLANNER Aug 2012 to Feb 2013 Office of Security Cooperation, Iraq Served as Training Integrated Project Team leading the Training and Sustainment Foreign Military Sales case load section. Conducted all facets of planning, synchronization, and training execution to assist Warfighter Focus contractors in the development of POIs and course execution. Managed hundreds of training and maintenance programs that involved thousands of Iraqi Army military personnel and almost 400 contracted security assistance trainers, making recommendations, adjustments to policies and programs to resolve problems and improve operations.

title: EXERCISE SITE SUPPORT PLANNER
description: Coordinated and synchronized the staff's efforts to include human resources, information technology, logistics, maintenance, medical, security and training. Planned, resourced and provided EXCON oversight for the United States Army's only bilateral Field Training Exercise with the Japanese Ground Self Defense Force (JGSDF). Successfully managed a $1M exercise operating budget with no cost overruns and wrote 10 service contracts in support of the exercise. Planned and supervised the execution of two major planning conferences and managed all associated travel coordination, funding, cargo shipments and life support for participants. Oversaw maintenance program for over 300 pieces of equipment including 30+ vehicles, communications equipment, weapons and night vision equipment.

description: Synchronized the Brigade's support of civil affairs outreach missions solidifying the brigade's relationship with its Iraqi Army and Police Division partners. Efficiently managed over 200 projects valued in excess of $31M which included the refurbishment of schools, the execution of an Iraqi businesswomen's conference, and coordinated several operations aimed at reconnecting the Iraqi people to the Iraqi Security Forces. Developed agricultural and public works programs and services and negotiating their respective contracts. Successfully trained, deployed, and executed operations during OIF as a combat advisor. Assisted Team Chief in duties and responsibilities for combat effectiveness, safety, and wellbeing of 30 soldiers and the maintenance and accountability of all associated equipment valued at more than $1M.

title: FIRES OFFICER
description: Served as Fires Officer for the Combat Support Coordination Team #3 (CSCT #3), a Joint and Combined coordination team forward deployed in the Republic of Korea. Responsible for the coordination of fires issues pertaining to wartime plans, theater level exercises, and other training events between the Combined Forces Command (CFC), United States Forces Korea (USFK), U.S. Augmentation Corps and the Third Republic of Korea Army (TROKA), the largest Field Army in the world with over 420,000 assigned Soldiers in wartime. Advised the TROKA staff on U.S. fires doctrine, tactics, techniques, and procedures. Assists the TROKA staff in development and translation of plans, reports, documents, and briefings. Served as the subject matter expert on all fires matters. Additionally served as Interim Team Officer and Team Operations Battle Captain.

description: First Lieutenant-3. Manages and directs the preservation, maintenance, and training efforts of 90 Departmental personnel-3. COLL: Seamanship Training Team, Leader-3; Boat Training Officer-3. WATCH: CDO U/I (Inport)-4. LV/TT. Commanding Officer Comments: Although billeted as Assistant OPS, quickly ramped up to be 1st Lieutenant on the departure of the incumbent. Versatile Officer. Served as the Assistant Operations Officer and the Acting Operations Officer during his first month aboard. Committed to Excellence. Led Department: during a very productive two month ship Repair Availability overseeing the overhaul, restoration, and preservation of Deck Department’s major pieces of equipment and spaces. Dedicated Mentor. Tutored Junior Officers for SWO qualification. Assisted with the SWO qualification of three junior officers during his short time aboard. Retention efforts resulted in ESSEX receiving the FYO% Retention Excellence Award. Dedicated and resourceful, Roger is excelling in a tough forward deployed billet!

description: Permanently Forward Deployed to the FIFTHFLT AOR in support of Operations ENDURING FREEDOM, IRAQI FREEDOM, and MARKET TIME II. Participated in SRA, ETSTA II, and Sea Swap. Engineer Office-6. Manages all aspects of engineering Departments material & training readiness, WATCH: Tactical Action. Officer-6. ODD Underway-6, Command Duty Officer-6. Assisted in fulfilling the administrative and training duties of the Executive Office and Chief Engineer. His assistance enhanced the readiness of Crew Charlie. Experienced MHC TAO. Stood watch during high visibility oil platform protection mission in Northern Arabian Gulf. During TAD assignment to MHC crew Charlie was entrusted to stand TAO while training prospective TAO’s in FIFTH FLT AOR operations. Active in training the Wardroom. As Senior Watch Officer, he actively mentored and prepared MHC crew JULIET's prospective Surface Warfare Officer’s. Two officers were qualified through his efforts.

title: PROPULSION GROUP OFFICER
description: Propulsion Aft Group Officer-9. Assisted two Division Officers and four Chiefs with the administration and training of over 100 personnel in two Main Machinery Rooms; WATCH: Junior Officer of the Watch-S, Engineering Duty Officer-8, Propulsion Plant Supervisor-9. COLL: physical Security Manager-9. Commanding Officer Comments: Lt Castro is enthusiastic and a motivated junior officer. Limitless energy and positive attitude directly contributed to the success of Kennedy’s propulsion division. His leadership and attention to detail led to the turn-a-round of the After Propulsion Group, material and personnel readiness have never been better. His extensive collateral duties reflect directly on his dedication. Coordinator for MTT, Phoenix Award, Video Teleconferencing, and ship's Diving Officer. Fully supports the ships QA Program; qualified CMPO, QAI, QAS and conducted audits of Engineering Controlled Work Packages. Supported both Engineering and Bridge underway watch teams. Qualified propulsion Plant Supervisor and Junior Officer of the Watch. An effective program manager. Conducted eight successful inventories during his tenure as the Engineering Department's Physical Security Manager. While serving as Aft Propulsion Group Officer, authored Short Range Training Plan that increased 2MMR and 3MMR material readiness and Watchstander proficiency.
